translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The reverse order of the law of conditionality

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  mahantara duka ādi
translated: The Numerical Series of Conditions in Pairs

original: Nasārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽(Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… purejāte āsevane ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na sa ārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā ekam pe purejāte āsevane ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a condition that is not a root cause and has a physical support as condition there arises a root cause that has a physical support.🔽(In brief:) In the case of root cause, there are three; in the case of object, three; in the case of predominance, one. … In the case of prenascence, one; in the case of nutriment, one. … In the case of non-hindrance, three.

original: Naanārammaṇaṁ nanahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na anārammaṇam na na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a condition that has a different object and is not a root cause as condition there arises a condition that has a physical support and is not a root cause. (In brief:) In the case of root cause, there are three; in the case of object, one. … In the case of non-hindrance, three.
